DataElement.preferredName: Progressive Disease Or Recurrent Disease Present Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indication of whether or not progressive disease or recurrent disease was present.

Property.preferredName: Progressive Disease Or Recurrent Disease Present
Property.preferredDefinition: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The return of a disease after a period of remission.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Equivalent CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 5946055 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the patient's disease pro
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient's disease progress or relapse during the indicated period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there a determination or suspicion of relapse or progression that has not been previously reported?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 100
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient developed a first relapse or progression that has not been previously reported?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient develop a first relapse/progression after enrollment that has not been previously reported?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have progressive disease (PD) per the revised International Neuroblastoma Risk Criteria (INRC) since the initial diagnosis of high-risk neuroblastoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient developed a first relapse that has not been previously reported?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient develop a malignancy relapse/progression after enrollment that has not been previously reported?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient develop relapse/progression after enrollment that has not been previously reported?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient experience any reportable adverse events during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient developed relapse that has not been previously reported?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient develop a relapse during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient experience relapse during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient experience relapse of underlying malignant disease during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have disease progression?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Radiographic evidence of objective progression as per RECIST 1.1.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient develop a first progression or relapse that has not been previously reported during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient experience disease progression/relapse during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient developed a first relapse or progression after start of Induction Cycle 3 that has not been previously reported?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the site of relapse/progression present at an earlier time point in therapy?

DataElement.changeDescription: Released. AK 2020-6-17; Created for CDSIC aligned NCI Standard CRFs. ghd CDE versioned to change short name from RSNY to RLPGIND per TESTCD naming convention decision. mc 5.14.20
